messages: 431d94cfba63fa3a13fb014f3038ee9c (04:43): Anyone here recomend rentacoder.com for html projects? I need my web site completed.
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (04:53): can I apply pseudo classes to classes?  e.g. is .class:after { ... } legitimate?
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:15): Can someone tell me why the following would happen and if there is a fix:  I have <div wrapper> <div sidebar-left> <div content>
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:16): pfn: Yes, that's legal
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:16): when I do a float:left for #sidebar-left and a float:right for #content i lose my border properties for #wrapper?
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:16): suedoh_: You don't lose the border, but the two divs go out of normal flow, meaning the wrapper has no reason to be bigger than 0. It collapses.
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:17): suedoh_: You need something after those divs inside the wrapper to have clear:both
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (05:17): are there any negative consequences to setting class="" on any element?
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (05:17): nanobot thanks... that's what I thought, I wonder why it didn't show up for me correctly...
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:17): Nanobot: Give me a sec, I'm trying to understand :)
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:18): pfn: You realize that IE doesn't support :after, right?
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:18): Nanobot: so what would be the most common way to do it ?
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:18): should i put a <div inside of wrapper after sidebar that has a clear:both ?
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (05:18): nanobot yes
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:18): suedoh_: After content
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:19): ok thanks
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (05:19): I do most of my work in FF
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:19): and the exact property is  clear: both;
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:19): suedoh_: Er, wait, is content inside sidebar-left?
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (05:19): I would appreciate IE7 if it increased css support... assholes (msft)
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:20): suedoh_: And yes, clear:both;
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:21): It would be after whatever is floated, but inside the container that you want to show up
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:21): And the clear element has to have some sort of content or height value so it doesn't collapse
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:23): Nanobot: Awesome, that hit it.
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:23): I'm not sure I understood much about it, but I'll have to read up.
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:23): Thanks
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:24): table-less Webpages are hard for me, as i've not done them much

01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:25): When something is floated, it goes out of normal flow, kind of like when something has position:absolute. So whatever is after the floated element isn't below it like it normally is.
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:26): So the container has nothing forcing it to be bigger than nothing, and it collapses.
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (05:26): If you put something inside with clear:both, it pushes that element below anything that's floated, therefore forcing the container to be larger
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:28): awesome, cleared it up
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:28): thanks
ff14f7e683f1f4fc1f97ae84c35aa1c4 (05:28): and this works for Firefox and IE also?
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:46): hello can someone please tell me why the #navbar-login div isnt displaying the dark blue bacground here: http://www.ug.cs.sunysb.edu/~sahnis
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:47): its login-navbar
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:47): sorry it should be navbar-login
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:48): i changed it in the html too
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:49): explain what you want
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:49): i'd like to get two div's side by side (navbar, and navbar-login)
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:50): also if anyone can explain to me any techniques i am missing in my attempt to create a tableless design
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:52): look brother
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:52): iif its only 2 columns
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:52): float one left
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:53): i did that, however now the row gets bigger
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:54): enclose them
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:54): within a wrapper div
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:54): of a set width
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:54): i see it was the padding that was messing it up
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:55): da-drew: what is your take on tableless css design?
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:55): i know theres a big war going on about it in industry
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:55): i think its a route you should take
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:55): unless tables are a necessity
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:55): which they are, in some rare cases
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:56): strict xhtml is the wave of the future baby
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:56): theres so much control over your presentation
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:57): da-drew: do you see flaws in my design so far?
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:57): so theres no flaws
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:57): but its not displaying the way you want
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (05:58): so i guess you could classify that as a flaw
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (05:59): and also im having a hard time figuring out why its displaying differently in IE and firefox
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (06:02): da-drew: if you open the same link i posted before in IE and in firefox you will see a slight difference in IE (bad one) http://www.ug.cs.sunysb.edu/~sahnis
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (06:02): hmm, I'm confused, I thought inline images had text wrapped around them automatically?
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (06:02): do I really have to float them?
d6769614780cd893b1493915e132b0ea (06:17): any idea why this site shows up differently in IE and differently in firefox: http://www.ug.cs.sunysb.edu/~sahnis
